Title: Barista and Cashier - Ajax, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Goldies Cafe + Eatery
Thanks for your interest in working with us at Goldies Cafe + Eatery!
Goldies Cafe + Eatery is a modern experience with a focus on incredible guest service, and great food and drinks. Our people, both guests and partners who work with us, are the most critical piece to our business and therefore always our biggest focus with every decision we make.
Our menu is focused around sandwiches, soups, salads, flatbreads and pastries, and is constantly changing to meet new trends and rising demands. We carefully source every ingredient we use, and stand behind every item we serve to our guests. Our products come in fresh and the majority are prepped on-site each day. We’ve also partnered with people and companies in the community to bring truly local products to our guests. We also work with our suppliers to bring the freshest and newest ingredients directly to our guests.
Each day our doors are open, Goldies will be committed to creating a great place for the community to enjoy, and a great place for the people who work here!
Our Team Members
Team members at Goldies love hospitality and the guest experience, creating a sense of fun along the way for everyone that comes through our doors. With focused training and a desire to want to contribute to something bigger than themselves, our people are the life of the operation.
Here are some key details of the ideal candidate we are looking for:
Fun, friendly, and a genuine desire for hospitality and the guest experience
Passion for teamwork and a team environment
Willingness to learn and eager to develop and grow with the business
Open to honest and real feedback focused on development and growth
Ability to change quickly, and continue to innovate with the newest product trends
Focus on cleanliness or organization
Ability to work days, evenings, and weekends
Reliable method of transportation for all shifts
The Barista/Cashier Role
As a Barista/Cashier, you’ll:
Be the source of creating a great guest experience, and achieving flawless operations
Exercise your entrepreneurial skills and unique service and taking responsibility for your service, every shift
Create an environment of connected, committed teamwork through non-stop communication and the willingness to help others win
Work in barista and guest service focused roles which can and will interchange even throughout a single shift depending on guest demand.
What you bring to the team:
Strong passion for food & drinks!
The belief that people are the source of extraordinary experiences, and the desire to deliver exemplary guest experiences, every day
Ninja-status time and task organization/prioritization skills, a willingness to learn and an openness to feedback, coaching and mentorship
The ability to strike up a conversation with anyone, and communication skills that foster seamless teamwork and smooth-sailing-shifts
Required SmartServe certification to responsibly serve alcohol in Ontario
Food Handler’s Certificate currently valid in Ontario
The ability to legally work in Canada (as a citizen, resident or holding other current and valid work permit)
Please note we are looking for full-time applicants only at this time.
How to Apply
Complete your online application through Indeed. Due to lots of eager and skilled applicants ready to take their career to the next level with us, we will only be responding to those candidates who have been selected for an interview. Those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted through email and/or Indeed messages.
We are looking forward to reviewing your application, and thanks for considering joining our team!
Part-time hours: 30 per week
Expected start date: 2021-12-13
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Salary: From $15.00 per hour
Additional pay:
Tips
Benefits:
Discounted or free food
On-site parking
Store discount
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Night shift
Weekend availability
Work remotely:
No

Title: Opportunities for Cashier (Retail) - Moncton, NB - Indeed.com
Description:
CASHIER
Kent is the largest retail building supply chain in Atlantic Canada. Our mission is to be the best source of home improvement products through superior service, quality products and everyday great prices. We protect our customers and staff by hiring and training associates committed to our safety values.
Kent is locally owned and operated, and we continue to grow in your community.
To be a great C
ashier

Title: Cashier/Customer Service - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Bakery Nakamura
Established in 1993, Bakery Nakamura is a family-owned Japanese bakery located in the heart of J-Town. We specialize in Japanese breads and buns and offer a wide variety of desserts. Using quality ingredients, all goods and products are made fresh daily from scratch.
We are currently hiring Cashiers.
Location
Markham, ON
Responsibilities
· Maintain and stock showcases for cakes and buns
· Package and assemble sandwiches and donuts for sale
· Assist customers with cake and bread orders
· Keep a clean store front and work environment
· Help the back of house when necessary (e.g., washing dishes)

· Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
· Must be able to stand for long periods of time
· Able to lift heavy objects (e.g., cooling racks, cake trays)
· Good communication skills: a second language is an asset
· Available to work weekdays and weekends

8hr+ shifts

Title: Cashier Receptionist - Dollard-Des Ormeaux, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
At Au Coq, the receptionist-cashier plays a key role since he is in direct contact with the customer. His welcome, his smile and his desire to provide first-rate service make all the difference. Customer satisfaction must be his priority. The receptionist-cashier receives customers at the counter and answers phone calls with speed and courtesy. He must listen to customers to guide them in their choices and take orders correctly. This position also has several cashier-related functions. A training session will give him or her in-depth knowledge of the menu, checkout procedures and how it works, as well as the various steps involved in balancing the cash register. They must also maintain a clean work environment at all times. The cashier-receptionist position allows you to acquire several skills: efficiency, listening skills and the ability to offer quality customer service. A receptionist-cashier who shows interest, versatility and initiative may be offered interesting opportunities for advancement.
Requirements :
Have a high school diploma or relevant experience with a cashier or in customer service
Have basic spoken English
Be responsible, honest, courteous, smiling and efficient.
Knowing how to count
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Salary: From $13.50 per hour
Work remotely:
No

Title: Sales Associate - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Summary:
Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures (WDSMP) has a Toronto-based Sales organization. This role is responsible for the management and execution of film sales for selected theatrical accounts and supporting the overall operations of the Canadian Sales team.
Responsibilities:
Establish, develop and maintain business relationships with exhibition circuits, theatre owners and film buyers for select accounts. Maximize and optimize our film releases in Canada, including French Quebec, with the use of negotiation skills, analytics and strong relationships.
Manage billings and collection of film rental and ensure accounts remain current.
Coordinate and schedule the classification of all feature films with regional classification boards.
Manage all aspects of pre-release & special screenings within Canada working with internal and external partners. This includes trade screenings, word of mouth screenings, promotional screenings, press and research screenings.
Analyze sales performance by account/customer.
Support Studio Cash Department to help manage daily cash applications.
Support the Sales team with entry and analysis of flash grosses and box office reports as well as monitoring program schedules, accounts receivables, payables, SAP Casual Buyer, etc.
Establish and build relationships with external distribution industry partners.
Basic Qualifications:
3+ years of sales experience preferably within the Entertainment or Media related Industry.
Current knowledge on business issues, trends and technological advances in the Entertainment Industry.
Strong negotiation and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal, communication, relationship building (internal/external) and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and manage a variety of initiatives/issues simultaneously.
Manage projects while dealing effectively with pressure and short timelines.
Ability to work well in a team environment.
Bilingual - French/English fluency is an asset.
Proficiency in studio-based systems, as well as third-party systems like ComScore and Webedia
Maintain standards of strict confidentiality with respect to all matters and documents.
Experience with SAP and AP/AR activities is an asset.
Strong computer proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Ability to travel as required.
Required Education
University Degree preferably with a Business focus or equivalent.
Additional Information:
Our Company proudly provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants. We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.

Title: Arena Cashier Receptionist - Hall, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
JOB POSTING
Internal/External – CUPE Local 1050
Position: Arena Cashier/Receptionist Status: Seasonal Part-time
Posting Date: November 18, 2021
Application deadline: December 2, 2021, by
4pm
Competition number: 21-67
Wage: $22.32 (plus $1.20 per hour in lieu of
benefits)
How to apply:
Please send your resume with competition number, in confidence to:
Human Resources Manager
City of Quesnel,
410 Kinchant Street,
Quesnel, BC V2J 7J5
Apply online or by Email: hr@quesnel.ca (Word or pdf document only please)
The City of Quesnel requires part-time Cashier Receptionists for the Quesnel & District Arena
concessions during the winter ice season. If you have a strong background in customer
service and experience working in an office environment then this could be a good
opportunity for you.
The City of Quesnel is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are
committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Nature of Position
The Cashier/Receptionist is responsible for the customer service at the concession and front
office in the arena facility. This position is part-time in nature and day, evenings and/or
weekend shifts are required. Ideal for anyone with customer service experience who is
interested in part-time employment.
Typical Duties:

Answering and directing phone calls and other inquires in a competent and friendly
manner

Processing admissions

Maintaining the office/concession in a clean, safe, sanitary, operable and efficient
manner

Booking facilities from time to time when needed

Preparing and selling concession items

Assisting in filing, maintaining attendance records and cash reports, and performing
general office procedures

Operating office equipment

Stocking of concession

Maintaining inventory control

Related duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
The Concession/Receptionist must possess the following qualifications:

Grade 12 education

Minimum 1 year demonstrated cashier and switchboard experience

Minimum 1 year experience in food and beverage hospitality or in a related customer-
service focused area

First Aid and C.P.R. certificate is a requirement

Foodsafe Level 1 certificate is a requirement

Serving it Right certificate is a requirement

Ability to handle cash and maintain accurate records

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, word processing and excel

Knowledge of office procedures and preparation of business letters and forms

Ability to focus attention on patrons needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times

Ability to deal with the public and staff in a professional manner
Job related testing may be required.
